Class DefaultFileHandler

java.lang.Object
  org.purl.sword.server.fedora.fileHandlers.DefaultFileHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
FileHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
JpegHandler, METSFileHandler, ZipFileHandler, ZipMETSFileHandler

extends java.lang.Object
implements FileHandler

Method Detail

isHandled

public boolean isHandled(java.lang.String pContentType,
                         java.lang.String pFormatNamespace)
This decides whether the File handler can handle the current deposit. Child classes must override this method

Specified by:
isHandled in interface FileHandler
Parameters:
String - the mime type
String - format namespace
Returns:
boolean if this handler can handle the current deposit

ingestDepost

public SWORDEntry ingestDepost(DepositCollection pDeposit,
                               ServiceDocument pServiceDocument)
                        throws SWORDException
This is the main method that is called to ingest a deposit. Override this if you want complete control over the ingest. This method calls all the other methods.

Specified by:
ingestDepost in interface FileHandler
Parameters:
DepositCollection - the deposit and its associated collection
ServiceDocument - the service document which this request applies to
Throws:
SWORDException - if any problems occured during ingest

getIdentifiers

protected java.util.List<Property> getIdentifiers(DepositCollection pDeposit)
This returns the Properties associated with the fedora object some of these properties are manditory so it is a good idea to call this method from any method that overrides it.

Parameters:
DepositCollection - the deposit and its associated collection
Returns:
List a list of properties for this object

getDublinCore

protected DublinCore getDublinCore(DepositCollection pDeposit)
This returns the dublin core from the deposit. This method guesses at dublin core values so you don't need to call it from child classes if you override it. All fedora objects have a dublin core record.

Parameters:
DepositCollection - the deposit and its associated collection
Returns:
DublinCore the dublin core from the deposit

getRelationships

protected Relationship getRelationships(DepositCollection pDeposit)
This returns the relationships for a deposit. This implementation assigns it to the collection specified in the service document.

Parameters:
DepositCollection - the deposit and its associated collection
Returns:
Relationship the relationships

getDatastreams

protected java.util.List<Datastream> getDatastreams(DepositCollection pDeposit)
                                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                                    SWORDException
This is the method that is most commonly overridden to provide new file handlers. Ensure you remove temp files unless you use LocalDatastream which cleans up after its self.

Parameters:
DepositCollection - the deposit and its associated collection
Returns:
List a list of datastreams to add
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if can't access a datastream
SWORDException - if there are any other problems

getDisseminators

protected java.util.List<Disseminator> getDisseminators(DepositCollection pDeposit,
                                                        java.util.List<Datastream> pDatastream)
Override this method if you want to add disseminators to an object. This implementation does not add any disseminators.

Parameters:
DepositCollection - the deposit and its associated collection
List - a list of the datastreams for the object

getSWORDEntry

protected SWORDEntry getSWORDEntry(DepositCollection pDeposit,
                                   ServiceDocument pServiceDocument,
                                   FedoraObject pFedoraObj)
                            throws SWORDException
This method is the general method that converts the service document and deposit into a SWORD entry. This is the overall method so if you want complete control on how the SWORDEntry is created overried this method otherwise overside the other SWORD Entry methods.

Parameters:
DepositCollection - the deposit and its associated collection
ServiceDocument - the service document associated with this request
FedoraObject - the object that has been ingested
Throws:
SWORDException

addServiceDocEntries

protected void addServiceDocEntries(SWORDEntry pEntry,
                                    Collection pCollection)
This just sets the treatment entry from the Collection found in the service document

Parameters:
SWORDEntry - the entry to add the treatment value to
Collection - the service document collection

addDepositEntries

protected void addDepositEntries(SWORDEntry pEntry,
                                 DepositCollection pDeposit)
This just sets the no op option and FormatNamespace from the deposit.

Parameters:
SWORDEntry - the entry to add the no op value to
DepositCollection - the deposit object

addIngestEntries

protected void addIngestEntries(DepositCollection pDeposit,
                                SWORDEntry pEntry,
                                FedoraObject pFedoraObj)
                         throws SWORDException
This methods adds entries about the ingest e.g. The URL to the deposit and links. The entries added here are Content and Link.

Parameters:
DepositCollection - the deposit and its associated collection
SWORDEntry - the entry to add the values to
FedoraObject - the ignested object
Throws:
SWORDException - if there is a problem accessing the properties file to find the URL to the deposit

getLinkName

protected java.lang.String getLinkName(DepositCollection pDeposit)
This specifies the datastream name for the object that was deposited. For example if a zip file was deposited the this would return the datastream that contains the zip file in Fedora not a link to the files that were in the zip file. This is used for creating the links.

Parameters:
DepositCollection - the deposit
Returns:
String the datastream name for the actual file deposited

addDCEntries

protected void addDCEntries(SWORDEntry pEntry,
                            DublinCore pDC)
This method tries to copy some of the dublin core elmenets into the SWORD entry object. The following entries are added; Author, Contributor, Rights, Summary and Title.

Parameters:
SWORDEntry - the entry to add to
DublinCore - the dublin core datastream to retrieve the data from

getCurrDateAsFedora

protected java.lang.String getCurrDateAsFedora()
Utility method to convert the current date to a date Fedora understands

Returns:
String the date in Fedora's requried format

getCurrDateAsAtom

protected java.lang.String getCurrDateAsAtom()
Utility method to convert the current date to a date from the Atom spec

Returns:
String the date in Atom's requried format

getTempDir

public java.lang.String getTempDir()
                            throws SWORDException
Returns the directory where deposited files can be stored before upload to fedora

Returns:
String the tempory directory
Throws:
SWORDException - if there is a problem retrieving the temp dir value from the properties file

getGenericFileName

protected java.lang.String getGenericFileName(DepositCollection pDeposit)
If the file name is unkown this method tries to get it from the deposit object getFilename method but if this is null it sets it to uploaded

Parameters:
DepositCollection - the deposit and its associated collection
String - the datastream name to use for the deposit.
